Posts.Content: Karen66 wrote: If any of you have reached remission, could you tell me how long it took up get there? I was diagnosed Stage IV in Jan. 2011. I had remission in Sept. 2011 but it only lasted for one month. I've been in treatment ever since and changing chemo drugs this week. Please ease my mind, and tell me it's still possible to get to remission. Dx 10/1/2003, DCIS, 3cm, Stage II, 1/14 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Dx 1/26/2011, IDC, Stage IV, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How Long Before Remission? Karen66 K-Lo

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2013 07:55AM Karen66 wrote: I have skin mets and so far the only thing that's worked for it is radiation. I am just beginning to discover all the stuff going on with my lungs. Mainly I have pleural effusions but one lung has a lot of fibrosis and doesn't work well. Right now, I am on a treatment holiday. Waiting to find out next step in treatment. I hope to have scans soon to find out where everything stands.
Posts.Title: lung and skin mets lollypop59 Bestbird

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2012 12:34PM Karen66 wrote: I've had skin mets for several months now. I was already past radiation and chemo for stage iv to bones and pleural effusion. I'm currently on Abraxane for 4 cycles (3 wks on and 1 wk off) I just started cycle 3 and no improvement yet. So maybe some is more stubborn than others.
Posts.Title: skin mets - how long does treatment take to work? gail5 gail5

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2012 12:28PM Karen66 wrote: Aaww, so sad about your dog (best friend).  It's so hard to let go of those who have given us so much comfort.  On your other news:  I'm so happy you have made it 5 years that I'm dancing for you!  I was 7 yrs. NED after 1st cancer diagnosis before I received news of Stage IV with Mets.  I know how incredible that 5 yr. mark feels.  I can't wait to feel it with Mets.  Congratulations and keep it up!!!  I'm in your corner!
Posts.Title: 5 year cancerversary. china myangels

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2012 04:55AM Karen66 wrote: Sorry to hear cancer has returned. My kids are 13 and 16 and I've been upfront and honest with them since the return I had. I try to keep everything as normal as I can for them. I also talk to them about who they can talk to if they need support. I make sure they have friends who know I have cancer and they feel comfortable talking to them. I also make sure they have adults to talk to if they don't want to talk to me about it. Most importantly, I just shower them with love everyday. Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: Cancer returned sammiryan chrissyb
